item.title: suggestions for health promotion programs
item.description: Office health advocacy - What is the water quality coming out of our coolers adn fawcets? I don't know if it is filtered or what I am drinking? Is it monitored? Healthy lifestyles - Navistar seems to have no program to encourage commuting to work by bike or foot. Need storage lockers for gear, incentives (since saving parking places too).

item.title: suggestions for health promotion programs
item.description: When planning the schedule for the fitness and exercise, please remember that some folks are just beginning. Find ways to encourage the overweight to feel comfortable starting the programs. Ex: privacy, slow but fun start. I am overweight and am not intimidated by others in the class but there are many who are and this would be a great way to get them started.

item.description: I think once the weather starts getting better Vital Lives should definitely focus on creating recreational program such as softball and volleyball. item.description: As we move into new Lisle Headquarters, it would be beneficial to have one-on-one meetings and/or group meetings on various topics as e-commerce can sometimes get boring and therefore lose interest.

item.title: suggestions for health promotion programs
item.description: Something more advanced for those of us who already are in good physical shape, eat right, excerise, have low blood pressure / cholesteral, etc. I've tried a few of the programs and some coaching and it's all very elementary. I'm a competitive runner, so I personally would be interested in knowing what my nutrition needs are (i.e. I think I need around 2800 calaries per day to maintain my 150 lb weight, do I need more protein, am I cutting out too much fat / electrolytes, etc).

item.description: none

item.title: suggestions for health promotion programs
item.description: To me the most benefial program provided by Vital Lives was the blood test. Not the finger prick but the full blown blood test that was offered several years ago. Navistar even published comments from employees promoting this by telling how the early detection of something discovered during the blood test that would have gone otherwise unnoticed. Then they discontinued it.

item.title: suggestions for health promotion programs
item.description: ZOOMBA, AEROBIC DANCE, YOGA

item.title: suggestions for health promotion programs
item.description: I enjoy your programs in general. Some thoughts. The TANA program is too long as it loses its momentum and being placed on teams with no interaction isn't worth the work. I would reallly love some programs that do not focus only on weight loss. Programs that support managing current weight, eating healthy and exercising more are of interest to me. Spring tune up is my favorite.

item.title: suggestions for health promotion programs
item.description: It would be a good idea to have a few self check blood pressure machines at Lisle.

item.title: suggestions for health promotion programs
item.description: Hatha Yoga classes after 5pm at least once a week. Transcendental Meditation classes after 5pm at least once a week. Hopefully yoga and meditation classes will not be on the same day so I can make it to both of them.

item.title: suggestions for health promotion programs
item.description: Many of the programs you've offered in the past are too simplistic or beginner level. I would rather see some more detailed, advanced level programs. I would also like to see more recreational programs than just softball, basketball, and volleyball. How about clubs/leagues for walking, running, biking, golf, etc.

item.title: suggestions for health promotion programs
item.description: There seems to be a lack of focus on strength training. This type of exercise is as important if not more so than endurance training.

item.title: suggestions for health promotion programs
item.description: Pilates classes in the fitness centers, program on exercises that can be done at your desk or workspace, mandatory "get up and move" times to force us to get up from our desks for a while.

item.title: suggestions for health promotion programs
item.description: Incentives always help when trying to motivate people to become healthier. I'm sure that there are some people who have the motivation without the knowledge, but if I smoked and wanted to quit bad enough, I would have sought help. I think it is the incentives where the company really has an advantage to pump up that motivation.

item.title: suggestions for health promotion programs
item.description: Programs that encouage physical activity all year long

item.title: suggestions for health promotion programs
item.description: Teaching healthy eating rather than dieting. Classes on growing and making food, gardening, cooking, knowing where to get local food, debunking common food "myths" or misunderstandingings, promoting wellness rather than just some simple habits.

item.title: suggestions for health promotion programs
item.description: More information on how and when to seek treatment.

item.title: suggestions for health promotion programs
item.description: Ping pong tables or similar activities to give a quick fun break. Something to get away from the desk and get the blood flowing.

item.title: suggestions for health promotion programs
item.description: Fitness workout areas be kept at a cold temperature to get a good workout (low sixties, nothing warmer than 64 deg F)

item.title: suggestions for health promotion programs
item.description: Need better ways to share Vital Lives programs with employees who work in the field/remotely

item.title: suggestions for health promotion programs
item.description: My group will be relocating to Axciom in Downers Grove vs. Lisle. I would be interested in having as many programs offered at the Downers Grove location as possible to improve morale and increase N-Gauge results.

item.title: suggestions for health promotion programs
item.description: Make it free for contractors to use the gym.

item.title: suggestions for health promotion programs
item.description: Having a free personal trainer for the first gym session would be beneficial not only to experience what you will be getting trained on, but to meet the staff.

item.description: How to deal with the building's environmental issues.

item.description: Interested in alternative medicine and remedies programs.

item.title: suggestions for health promotion programs
item.description: If nothing else Vital Lives provides an important communication/awareness forum for employees. We all need an occassional push to think about our health (and not take it for granted).

item.title: suggestions for health promotion programs
item.description: I am interested in programs with personal or classroom interface, not online stuff.

item.description: Have a yoga class available at the Fitness Center.

item.title: suggestions for health promotion programs
item.description: I really enjoy the company's role in sponsoring the running events. Maybe more needed regarding biking events.

item.title: suggestions for health promotion programs
item.description: golf league, bowling league

item.title: suggestions for health promotion programs
item.description: I have no suggestions.

item.title: suggestions for health promotion programs
item.description: It would be nice for Vital Lives to recognize the Woodridge PSC independently and/or provide programs that occur at our location. I, often times, want to participate in the blood drives, info sessions, and other activities that occur at the WHQ, but am not able to due to the time of travel and normal working hours.

item.title: suggestions for health promotion programs
item.description: Rec programs - summer volleyball nights, winter basketball nights...

item.title: suggestions for health promotion programs
item.description: walking group at Lisle -- could have a poker walk (or some kind of special walk) to kick this off

item.title: suggestions for health promotion programs
item.description: Yoga is a good way to keep muscles flexible and stress management. I would like to see yoga classes being offered at the lisle fitness center.

item.title: suggestions for health promotion programs
item.description: Make it easier for individuals to participate without having to be a part of a team.

item.title: suggestions for health promotion programs
item.description: Make the most of the Lisle campus -- put up "mile markers" inside so we can tell how far we've walked. Possibly have different incentive programs: "Walktoberfest" in October...

item.title: suggestions for health promotion programs
item.description: Since there are softball fields right behind work, a work league would be cool, as well as a work basketball and volleyball leagues. I would be interested in participating.

item.title: suggestions for health promotion programs
item.description: There used to be a tennis club when the company was located downtown. Would love to see that rekindled this year. Company provided tennis balls one can of tennis balls for each match and had a central point where scores were reported for seeding for a year-end tournament and small trophy that was given to the winners in the intermediate and advanced groups. All matches were held offsite after hours by agreement between the participants, which limits the companies liability when compared to the volleyball matches that are held near the company parking lot. I am sure people would also be willing to sign a waiver as well to limit company liability.

item.title: suggestions for health promotion programs
item.description: Aeorbics at lunch

item.title: suggestions for health promotion programs
item.description: I really enjoyed the Wii tennis tournament that was held at Warrenville a couple of years ago. I would like to see this continue possibly as a winter event.

item.title: suggestions for health promotion programs
item.description: Would be nice if more advanced diet and exercise info was available for those seeking "personal trainer" level knowledge. Would also love the opportunity to play on a company league soccer team.

item.description: Many people are motivated by a competition. I would like to see more competitions. TANA doesn't really work, because it is somewhat anonymous. item.title: CHANGE about Vital Lives
item.description: I would re-implement a health club reimbursement program covering a substantial to a full amount of monthly dues, pending club attendance at least 50% of the month. This can be done in cooperation with local clubs to share attendance information. On-site facilities, though the intentions are good simply aren't large enough and get poor attendance in general for a multitude of reasons. Why invest in these facilites when a substantial amount of people don't use them, instead we could allocate that investment and re-start a health club reimbursement program pending a monthly mandatory attendance rate.
